title: Ryan Hawley reveals favourite Emmerdale moment as he exits the soap
text:
Emmerdale viewers were left heartbroken earlier this year when it was revealed that actor Ryan Hawley was departing from the ITV soap which, of course, inevitably meant that his beloved character Robert Sugden — one half of fan-favourite pairing Robron — would have to be written out.

Robert’s exit storyline will see the character face the consequences of his actions after he attacked Victoria’s (Isabel Hodgins) rapist with a shovel and left him for dead. Following the attack, the young man deliberated over what to do for the best, before coming to the decision to plead guilty, as he hoped this would result in a reduced sentence.

However, in the coming episodes, Robert will learn that rapist Lee has died, and thus he’ll be faced with a dilemma of whether to stay and face the music, or go on the run with husband Aaron (Danny Miller). Eventually, he decides on the latter.

Whether or not he’ll get away remains to be seen but, either way, Robert’s exit will be the end of an era for Emmerdale. The character has been at the heart and soul of some of the soap’s biggest ever moments, and he’s been one half of one of the most popular soap couples of all time, which is a pretty incredible legacy to leave behind.

Ryan spoke about his favourite moment on the ITV soap saying: ‘I was so lucky to be involved in the big crash scenes in 2016. The underwater scenes that we filmed at Pinewood studios were fantastic to do. Me and Danny got to have a lot of fun there swimming in a tank.’

‘There were so many special effects in the crash sequence that week it was probably the biggest thing Emmerdale has ever done and it was amazing to be a part of it. I have been very lucky to be involved in some very ambitious stunts and storylines but that was the stand out one: everyone pulled together, we were up against the odds but I really think we managed to pull it off.’

Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV.
